title: Case Records

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please furnish the case number and all associated case files including any forensics reports, officer reports/statements etc., statements taken from parties involved(including PBSO employees), attorney/lawyer correspondence for any parties involved in the case (including PBSO employees). The attempted murder case took place on 11/25/2021 in Jupiter Farms FL Palm Beach County at the intersection of 185 St N and 120th Trail North  (26.949481337437533, -80.22448518988503) and was of Mason C. Turner  DOB: 06/02/1997

Also please include the current case status and the investigator assigned to the case. And any case conclusion files if the case is concluded.

For your reference, please see the attached evidence submitted to forensics. 
(A Google link has been provided for your convenience) 
(ZIP) https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AeZsTObZCqzNAMr8KkZM2pqqEclD8Arb/view?usp=sharing
(Non ZIP)  https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1nv-_5RQvf55TBHW25tQOVH2dvW02XuLI?usp=sharing
If you have a preferred method of document transfer, I can also transfer my files in an alternative way. Including uncompressed original Sony ARW files with original unaltered meta data.

Should there be any redactions, please provide a redaction form and the corresponding law pertaining to each redaction made as required by law.

Proprietary login systems are not covered under State Law so Please furnish records and respond to this request via the email address it was received from. Download links are supported without personal information or login requirements.

There should not be any fees associated with this request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Mason C. Turner
561-320-7690

title: FOIA - Veritone Documents (Escondido Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to the your agency's contract with Veritone (https://www.veritone.com). These documents might include, but are not limited to, the following:

- Initial Bid Documents
- Current and previous contracts with Veritone regarding any of the offerings/software
- Requests for Proposals
- Memorandum(s) of Understanding
- Any privacy impact assessments
- Any product manuals
- Any instructional materials or presentations
- Use policies and standard operating procedures
- Data retention policies
- Letters of Interest
- Usage policies
- Any informal agreements or other documents that reference "Veritone" or otherwise guide it use or the relationship between this agency and the provider or developer of the software.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.subject: Your City of Lake Stevens public records request #23-1693 has been opened.
communications.communication:
City of Lake Stevens ************************************************************************ Your record request #23-1693 has been submitted successfully. The City received your request for public records today and will respond as required by RCW 42.56.520, within five business days. In calculating the five business days, the following are not counted: the day the City receives the request, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays. RCW 1.12.040. See also WAC 44-14-03006.  If the request is received by the City after City business hours, the request shall be deemed to have been received by the City on the next business day.  A response may be (a) providing the records, (b) providing a link to records available on line, (c) providing a reasonable estimated date of when the records will be available, (d) requesting clarification, or (e) denial of the request.   ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Lake Stevens.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USDOS 12.11.23
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA officer:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

Copies of records for a grant and/or contract awarded by the United States Department of State to the Global Internet Freedom Consortium (GIFC) in 2010. Please see the following link from the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC): http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/americas/8678760.stm

The lede in the above BBC article states: "A Falun Gong-linked group that promotes internet freedom says the US state department has offered it $1.5m, in a move condemned by Chinese officials."

The GIFC, as noted, is linked to practitioners of Falun Gong, a new religious movement originating from China. Falun Gong members have created and currently run non-profit organizations, media companies, and human rights groups, all of which focus on censorship and human rights abuses in China, and because of this, the group and its associated entities have received public and financial support from the United States government.

Yet, in 2021, news organizations such as National Public Radio (NPR) reported on disputes within the United States Agency for Global Media (USAGM) over a contract (award ID: 95170021K0011) awarded to Ultrareach Internet Corp. (UEI: P9R8NZXL3SH3), a member of the GIFC, in 2020. Please see the following link from NPR: https://www.npr.org/2021/04/14/986982387/falun-gong-steve-bannon-and-the-trump-era-battle-over-internet-freedom

In the above NPR article, Matthew Baise, director of digital strategy and audience development for Voice of America, a child organization of the USAGM, was quoted from an internal audit as stating the following of Ultrasurf, software developed by Ultrareach Internet Corp. and promoted by the GIFC: "We spent nearly two weeks checking and double-checking how the number could possibly be this low. We believe the true, final number of measurable traffic from Ultrasurf to be so miniscule because a) none of the networks were ever notified of its existence so it was never promoted b) it's only available for Windows desktop machines (almost all our audience is on mobile devices) and c) it is a brand new product. In the absence of promotion on Ultrasurf's end, this thing was essentially invisible."

Given public reporting on the dispute over contract ID 95170021K0011 and the apparent failure of Ultrasurf to meet the parameters of that contact, any other financial support, whether through grants or contracted work, awarded to the GIFC and its member organizations can reasonably be understood as being of public interest.

This request includes, but is not limited to:

- Correspondence (traditional mail, faxes, email, etc.)

- Requests for Proposals

- Requests for Information

- Statements of Work

- Memorandum(s) of Understanding

- Letters of Interest

- Award Letters

- Task Letters

- Privacy Impact Assessments

- Invoices

- Purchase and/or Change Orders

- Project Budgets and/or Budget Proposals

- Evaluation Reports

- Presentations by the Global Internet Freedom Consortium

I am asking you to waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. My bylines, which include Unicorn Riot, the Geopolitical Economy Report, and Creem Magazine, can be found in both print and electronic publications. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

A fee waiver is appropriate in situations where "disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of the government, and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester,” 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(iii). Reasons for public interest have been noted above.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USAGM 12.11.23
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA officer:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

Copies of records for award IDs BBG50J130237, BBG50J120406, and BBG50P100171. These IDs are associated with contracts awarded to a business, Ultrareach Internet Corp. (UEI: P9R8NZXL3SH3), for work done with a predecessor to the United States Agency for Global Media (USAGM), the Broadcasting Board of Governors (BBG). This request includes, but is not limited to:

- Correspondence (traditional mail, faxes, email, etc.)

- Requests for Proposals

- Requests for Information

- Statements of Work

- Memorandum(s) of Understanding

- Letters of Interest

- Award Letters

- Task Letters

- Privacy Impact Assessments

- Invoices

- Purchase and/or Change Orders

- Project Budgets and/or Budget Proposals

- Evaluation Reports

- Presentations by Ultrareach Internet Corp.

I am asking you to waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. My bylines, which include Unicorn Riot, the Geopolitical Economy Report, and Creem Magazine, can be found in both print and electronic publications. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

A fee waiver is appropriate in situations where "disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of the government, and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester,” 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(iii). Ultrareach Internet Corp. is a business associated with the Global Internet Freedom Consortium (GIFC). Please see the following link: http://www.internetfreedom.org/about/index.html

Both Ultrareach Internet Corp. and the GIFC are run by practitioners of Falun Gong, a new religious movement originating from China. Falun Gong members have created and currently run non-profit organizations, media companies, and human rights groups, all of which focus on censorship and human rights abuses in China, and because of this, the group and its associated entities have received public and financial support from the United States government. In 2010, for instance, the United States Department of State awarded the GIFC $1.5 million. Please see the following link: http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/americas/8678760.stm

Yet, in 2021, news organizations such as National Public Radio (NPR) reported on disputes within the USAGM over a contract awarded to Ultrareach Internet Corp. in 2020 (award ID: 95170021K0011). Please see the following link: https://www.npr.org/2021/04/14/986982387/falun-gong-steve-bannon-and-the-trump-era-battle-over-internet-freedom

In the NPR article, Matthew Baise, director of digital strategy and audience development for Voice of America, a child organization of the USAGM, was quoted from an internal audit as stating the following of Ultrasurf, software developed by Ultrareach Internet Corp.: "We spent nearly two weeks checking and double-checking how the number could possibly be this low. We believe the true, final number of measurable traffic from Ultrasurf to be so miniscule because a) none of the networks were ever notified of its existence so it was never promoted b) it's only available for Windows desktop machines (almost all our audience is on mobile devices) and c) it is a brand new product. In the absence of promotion on Ultrasurf's end, this thing was essentially invisible."

Given public reporting on the dispute over contract ID 95170021K0011 and the apparent failure of Ultrasurf to meet the parameters of that contact, any prior contracts awarded to Ultrareach Internet Corp. by the USAGM's predecessor, the BBG, can reasonably be understood as being of public interest. Additionally, the total obligations of the BBG contracts was over $10 million and extended across multiple years; therefore, any prior work completed by Ultrareach Internet Corp. warrants public scrutiny, based on financial commitments alone.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

title: Chicago Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses Information Request

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Chicago Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past one month (November 11 2023-December 11 2023) regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance" in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses" as described in Sec. 8-4-090 in Chicago's city code.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance
• written notices from the authorized representatives of the city to the owner or controller of the premises identifying nuisances and abatement measures
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
•fines and penalties collected for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
• information regarding any court actions related thereto, including motions for court orders to place a property into receivership or condemnation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

title: Destruction of FISA-acquired Information and Other Information Affecting Americans (Central Intelligence Agency)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a Freedom of Information Act Request for all documents after February 9, 2022, listing the following:

 The amount of individuals whose records were disposed of, in whole or part, using the minimization procedure under the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act, which allows for bulk warrantless electronic surveillance of  non-consenting Americans, and the collection of their personal communication and other things on Americans that are not publicly available, that are collected either through direct targeting of Americans under FISA Title VII, which is about to expire, or are collected on non-consenting Americans incidentally pursuant to targeting a foreign actor, then is destroyed (the information collected). This is also a request for the number of individuals 702-acquired information was disposed of, purged, deleted, removed, or destroyed, including destroyed upon recognition, in whole or part, because of noncompliance incidents, including but not limited to when violations of law occurred. Some of this destruction of 702-acquired information and destruction of other FISA-acquired information that were destroyed in violations of law is permitted under FISC Rules of Procedure, Rule 13, as was created by Congress.

While the government’s reason behind disposing of personal communication and other information collected on non consenting Americans who are electronically surveilled appears to seem to protect American’s privacy, it can have the opposite effect if used to cover when the surveillance or other related activities were carried out illegally or information was collected in noncompliance with law. This is especially problematic when federal contractors, who concurrently worked with the government on military matters, law enforcement, and national security matters were sued in a court of law for targeting innocent Americans in clandestine investigations on behalf of corporate clients. Please see Case 1:15-cv-09796-JSR, opinion issued by Judge Jed S. Rakoff in United States District Court of New York, signed July 25, 2016 and GSA   Mission Oriented Business Integrated Services (MOBIS) Contract GS-10F-0010X, both concerning the federal contracting company known as Global Precision Research. Please see https://highergov.com/awardee/global-precision-research-llc-13199850/ (last retrieved December 1, 2023). 

This is also a request for all documents related to the complete removal of all Section 702-acquired information from the FBI system mentioned on page 39 of the publicly released April 21, 2022 dated Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court Opinion and Order that was declassified partially and authorized for public release on May 19, 2023, by DNI. Users of this system also were advised to use Sharepoint, as is mentioned on the same page. I believe this is a cloud system. Furthermore, this is a request for the entire FISC Opinion and Order to be declassified, including all related documents, including but not limited to the following: memos, motions, exhibits, discussing all noncompliance incidents under FISA and related law.
I would have addressed this earlier but issues arose.

I ask for a waiver or fees, as this request is not being made for commercial purposes. Furthermore, I have worked free of charge at getting laws passed, including laws for children, such as laws banning corporal punishment against disabled students in Louisiana public and charter schools, and am currently working on a book to raise awareness that I made publicly available at no charge in a very, very rough draft form on shortcomings in federal labor laws in Agriculture that affect children, shortcomings in FERPA laws concerning online education and children’s privacy rights, and FISA law in a highly fictional manner. I wish to see FISA law changed so that there is a way to document Americans who were surveilled and what was collected on them while also protecting 4th Amendment Rights. See https://www.change.org/p/please-amend-louisiana-revised-statute-17-223-and-17-416-1-which-allows-corporal-punishment-in-louisiana-schools-against-disabled-students , https://beitcrew.com/pages/copy-of-child-advocacy-with-be-it-crew , https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/home

Please contact me if the fees exceed 100 dollars.

Respectfully, 

Shayna A. Pitre

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shayna A. Pitre

title: Destruction of FISA-acquired Information and Other Information Affecting Americans (National Security Agency)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a Freedom of Information Act Request for all documents after February 9, 2022, listing the following:

 The amount of individuals whose records were disposed of, in whole or part, using the minimization procedure under the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act, which allows for bulk warrantless electronic surveillance of  non-consenting Americans, and the collection of their personal communication and other things on Americans that are not publicly available, that are collected either through direct targeting of Americans under FISA Title VII, which is about to expire, or are collected on non-consenting Americans incidentally pursuant to targeting a foreign actor, then is destroyed (the information collected). This is also a request for the number of individuals 702-acquired information was disposed of, purged, deleted, removed, or destroyed, including destroyed upon recognition, in whole or part, because of noncompliance incidents, including but not limited to when violations of law occurred. Some of this destruction of 702-acquired information and destruction of other FISA-acquired information that were destroyed in violations of law is permitted under FISC Rules of Procedure, Rule 13, as was created by Congress.

While the government’s reason behind disposing of personal communication and other information collected on non consenting Americans who are electronically surveilled appears to seem to protect American’s privacy, it can have the opposite effect if used to cover when the surveillance or other related activities were carried out illegally or information was collected in noncompliance with law. This is especially problematic when federal contractors, who concurrently worked with the government on military matters, law enforcement, and national security matters were sued in a court of law for targeting innocent Americans in clandestine investigations on behalf of corporate clients. Please see Case 1:15-cv-09796-JSR, opinion issued by Judge Jed S. Rakoff in United States District Court of New York, signed July 25, 2016 and GSA   Mission Oriented Business Integrated Services (MOBIS) Contract GS-10F-0010X, both concerning the federal contracting company known as Global Precision Research. Please see https://highergov.com/awardee/global-precision-research-llc-13199850/ (last retrieved December 1, 2023). 

This is also a request for all documents related to the complete removal of all Section 702-acquired information from the FBI system mentioned on page 39 of the publicly released April 21, 2022 dated Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court Opinion and Order that was declassified partially and authorized for public release on May 19, 2023, by DNI. Users of this system also were advised to use Sharepoint, as is mentioned on the same page. I believe this is a cloud system. Furthermore, this is a request for the entire FISC Opinion and Order to be declassified, including all related documents, including but not limited to the following: memos, motions, exhibits, discussing all noncompliance incidents under FISA and related law.
I would have addressed this earlier but issues arose.

I ask for a waiver or fees, as this request is not being made for commercial purposes. Furthermore, I have worked free of charge at getting laws passed, including laws for children, such as laws banning corporal punishment against disabled students in Louisiana public and charter schools, and am currently working on a book to raise awareness that I made publicly available at no charge in a very, very rough draft form on shortcomings in federal labor laws in Agriculture that affect children, shortcomings in FERPA laws concerning online education and children’s privacy rights, and FISA law in a highly fictional manner. I wish to see FISA law changed so that there is a way to document Americans who were surveilled and what was collected on them while also protecting 4th Amendment Rights. See https://www.change.org/p/please-amend-louisiana-revised-statute-17-223-and-17-416-1-which-allows-corporal-punishment-in-louisiana-schools-against-disabled-students , https://beitcrew.com/pages/copy-of-child-advocacy-with-be-it-crew , https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/home

Please contact me if the fees exceed 100 dollars.

Respectfully, 

Shayna A. Pitre

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shayna A. Pitre

title: Social Media: Santa Rosa County Sheriff's Office

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Social Media: Santa Rosa County Sheriff's Office
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request seeks records relating to the Facebook located at https://www.facebook.com/santarosasheriff. An example of what each of these records look like is available at https://bit.ly/facebookfoia.

In order to access the requested information, you will first need to take the following steps:

1. Log into the page account or a Facebook account with managerial access to the Facebook page. For information on this type of access, see: https://www.facebook.com/help/187316341316631.)
2. "Switch" to the page account. To do so, click your profile photo in the top right, then click "See all profiles", then select the Page you want to switch into. (See the instructions here: https://www.facebook.com/help/123930246348340).
3. Click "Professional dashboard" on the left, or go to this URL https://www.facebook.com/santarosasheriff/?sk=professional_dashboard.


I request the following information:

1. The "Page and Tagging" information. Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=timeline&privacy_source=timeline_gear_menu.

2. The list of blocked users. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block users"
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

3. The list of blocked Pages. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block Pages"
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

4. The list of "Moderation Assist" criteria. This information is accessible by following either of these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard" and then click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen.
(b) Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/santarosasheriff/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist.

5. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has certain keywords", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has certain keywords").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has certain keywords"
(d) On the right side of the "Keywords" menu, click the ellipsis menu ("...")
(e) Click "Copy list" from the dropdown menu.
(f) Provide the information from the list.

6. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has specific links", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has specific links").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has links to specific sites."
(d) Provide the information from the "Added sites" list.

7. The list of people with Facebook access. From the "Professional dashboard" page (https://www.facebook.com/santarosasheriff/?sk=professional_dashboard), click "Page Access" on the left side of the screen. Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=profile_access.

8. The list of moderation actions in the Activity log. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard."
(b) Click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/santarosasheriff/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist).
(c) Click "Activity log" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/santarosasheriff/professional_dashboard/moderation_activity_log).
(c) From the dropdown menu labeled "Visible comments", select "Hidden comments".
(d) Continue scrolling down until the complete list is loaded.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.communication:

title: FOIL Request for Records Pertaining to Anita Murphy’s Involvement with Capital Region BOCES

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Records Pertaining to Anita Murphy’s Involvement with Capital Region BOCES
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of records that detail the relationship and communications between Anita Murphy, in her various capacities including but not limited to “Special Project Administrator,” and the Capital Region BOCES, including its Board of Education.

Specifically, I am seeking the following:

	1.	Contracts and Agreements: Any and all contracts, agreements, or terms of employment related to Anita Murphy’s roles, including as “Special Project Administrator” or any other named or unnamed positions, with the Capital Region BOCES from December 1, 2022, to the present.
	2.	Meeting Minutes and Resolutions: Copies of meeting minutes and resolutions of the Board of Education where Anita Murphy’s employment, resignation, rehiring, consultancy, or involvement in any capacity was discussed or decided upon from December 1, 2022, to the present.
	3.	Correspondence: Any written correspondence, including emails, memos, and letters, between Anita Murphy and key officials of the Capital Region BOCES, including board members, regarding her roles, responsibilities, or any related matters in any capacity from December 1, 2022, to the present.
	4.	Documentation of Services Rendered: Records detailing the services provided by Anita Murphy in her various capacities to the Capital Region BOCES, including consultancy reports, assessments, or any other deliverables.
	5.	Invoices and Payments: All invoices submitted by Anita Murphy for services rendered in any capacity, and records of remittances or payments made to her by the Capital Region BOCES from December 1, 2022, to the present.

Please exclude any information that falls under the exemptions of the Freedom of Information Law, such as information that would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy or attorney-client privileged communications.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: FOIL Request for Data Supporting COVID-19 Vaccine Efficacy for Holiday Season Health Protection

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Data Supporting COVID-19 Vaccine Efficacy for Holiday Season Health Protection
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to records that support the statement made by State Health Commissioner Dr. James McDonald, as reported on December 6, 2023, in Spectrum Local News: “If you don’t want to be sick for the holidays, grab the COVID vaccine.” Specifically, I am interested in:

	1.	Any statistical data, studies, or reports from January 1, 2023, to December 6, 2023, demonstrating the effectiveness of the COVID-19 vaccine in preventing illness during the 2023 holiday season.
	2.	Information regarding the timeline for COVID-19 vaccine effectiveness, particularly in relation to the period between vaccination and development of immunity, in the context of the holiday season.
	3.	Comparative analysis of COVID-19 infection rates, hospitalizations, and fatality rates among vaccinated versus unvaccinated populations in New York State during the 2023 holiday season.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: List of Individuals: Hinds County Coroners Office
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to public records regarding the individuals buried behind the local jail in Jackson, MS, specifically pertaining to Dexter Wade. I understand that the Hinds County Coroner's Office maintains a list dating back to 2016, as well as incident files for each individual.
I am seeking access to:
-The list of individuals buried behind the local jail maintained by the Hinds County Coroner's Office, including any available information regarding Dexter Wade and others dating back to 2016.
- The incident files or records related to each individual listed in the aforementioned burial records.
- The number of deaths, when the deaths occurred, the causes of death, and the names, age, and places of residence of those who died at Hinds County Detention Facility
Please consider this a formal request under the Mississippi Public Records Act; Miss. Code Ann. 25-61-1 et seq.. If any part of this request is unclear or requires further specification, please do not hesitate to contact me using the information provided above.
If there are any fees associated with obtaining or copying these records that exceed $100, I request a waiver of all fees. I am making this request on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, and the release of this information is in the public interest.
If possible, I would prefer to receive the requested documents electronically via email. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Noelle

title: List of Individuals: Hinds County Coroner's Office (Jacksonville Police Department)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: List of Individuals: Hinds County Coroner's Office (Jacksonville Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to public records regarding the individuals buried behind the local jail in Jackson, MS, specifically pertaining to Dexter Wade. I understand that the Hinds County Coroner's Office maintains a list dating back to 2016, as well as incident files for each individual.
I am seeking access to:
- The list of individuals buried behind the local jail maintained by the Hinds County Coroner's Office, including any available information regarding Dexter Wade and others dating back to 2016.
- The incident files or records related to each individual listed in the aforementioned burial records.
- The number of deaths, when the deaths occurred, the causes of death, and the names, age, and places of residence of those who died at Hinds County Detention Facility
Please consider this a formal request under the Mississippi Public Records Act; Miss. Code Ann. 25-61-1 et seq.. If any part of this request is unclear or requires further specification, please do not hesitate to contact me using the information provided above.
If there are any fees associated with obtaining or copying these records that exceed $100, I request a waiver of all fees. I am making this request on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, and the release of this information is in the public interest.
If possible, I would prefer to receive the requested documents electronically via email. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Noelle

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - FBI - Metal Gear
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents alerts mentioning "Metal Gear" or "Metal Gear Solid" created from January 1st 1997 to the date of this request.

Metal Gear was a video game series developed by Konami (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metal_Gear).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

J Ader

title: Public Records Request - Hickory Hill Funeral Home, Memphis

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request - Hickory Hill Funeral Home, Memphis
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request copies of any records the Department of Commerce and Insurance's State Board of Funeral Directors and Embalmers has pertaining to the Hickory Hill Funeral Home in Memphis (5270 Knight Arnold Road). I am specifically seeking records related to the discovery of two deceased women in the home in March 2016. The types of records I am interested in include: complaints, site investigations, notices of violation (NOVs), return to compliance documentation, and those related to the suspension of the home's license (motions, complaints, summary judgments, etc.).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Caitlin Downey.

communications.subject: Tennessee Department of Commerce and Insurance - Public Records Request Cost Estimation
communications.communication:
Good morning Mr. Hoover,

My name is Troy Bryant, I am the Associate General for regulatory boards and I am in receipt of your public records request.

To fulfill your request there will be a slight charge and I wanted to reach out to you before moving forward. My paralegal has estimated that it will take 3 hours to fulfill your request.
For purposes of the cost incurred, the first hour is free, so in actuality it will only be the charge for two hours of the paralegal's time at $34.74 per hour for a total cost of $69.48.

While that figure is just an estimate (it may be slightly higher or lower than the estimated figure), the estimation is usually fairly accurate.

If you would like to proceed with your public records request given the amount of the estimation, please let me know.

Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DA2901.D4840960]
Troy Bryant | Associate General Counsel, Regulatory Boards Division
Office of Legal Counsel
Davy Crockett Tower, 12th Floor
500 James Robertson Pkwy, Nashville, TN 37243
615-770-0447
Troy.Bryant@tn.gov<mailto:Troy.Bryant@tn.gov>
tn.gov/commerce<http://www.tn.gov/commerce>

title: Voting Rights Restoration

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Voting Rights Restoration
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to see how many persons have applied to have their voting rights restored in Alabama after convictions from the following states over a 10-year period. 

I would also like to know how many of these applicants successfully had their voting rights restored. 

The states I would like to look at are as follows:
 
California, Colorado, New York, Illinois, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Michigan, and Indiana.

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Bobby Mandelberg.
